name: meep
description:
Meep (or MEEP) is a free finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) simulation
software package developed at MIT to model electromagnetic systems.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: harminv
dependencies.description:
Harminv is a free program (and accompanying library) to solve the
problem of harmonic inversion - given a discrete-time, finite-length
signal that consists of a sum of finitely-many sinusoids (possibly
exponentially decaying) in a given bandwidth, it determines the
frequencies, decay constants, amplitudes, and phases of those sinusoids.

dependencies.name: guile
dependencies.description:
Guile is the GNU Ubiquitous Intelligent Language for Extensions, the
official extension language for the GNU operating system.

dependencies.name: libctl
dependencies.description:
libctl is a free Guile-based library implementing flexible control files
for scientific simulations.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: gsl
dependencies.description:
The GNU Scientific Library (GSL) is a numerical library for C and C++
programmers. It is free software under the GNU General Public License.
The library provides a wide range of mathematical routines such as
random number generators, special functions and least-squares fitting.
There are over 1000 functions in total with an extensive test suite.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: swig
dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.

dependencies.name: py-mpi4py
dependencies.description:
This package provides Python bindings for the Message Passing Interface
(MPI) standard. It is implemented on top of the MPI-1/MPI-2
specification and exposes an API which grounds on the standard MPI-2 C++
bindings.

dependent_to.name: py-python-meep
dependent_to.description:
Python-meep is a wrapper around libmeep. It allows the scripting of
Meep-simulations with Python
